mods:mods.mods:abstract: Transmits intelligence concerning one Colonel Connolly, a Loyalist officer during the Revolution, who has came to Fort Harmar last winter and has now set out for Louisville. The ostensible reason for Connolly's trip is a need to visit landholdings in the area, but St. Clair is convinced Connolly is a British agent sent to detach settlers from the U.S. or, if that fails, to attack the Spanish frontier. Has written Wyllys to keep an eye on Connolly. Negotiations with Indians will begin soon. Brant has returned to Detroit, taking the Mohawks and other Iroquois tribes with him. St. Clair thinks may work to American advantage in long run. Hopes for peace on the New York and Pennsylvania frontiers this winter, lower Virginia frontier is open to attack. British retention of posts allows them to stir up unrest among Indians. Comments on role of the west in America's future -- will it be a boon or a drain on government resources? Spanish are trying to entice Americans to settle in their territories. Rumors of grant Morgan has received from Spain. Fears Morgan will persuade other American settlers to join him. St. Clair's efforts to counteract Morgan's efforts. Encloses a copy of Hamtramck's letter detailing Spanish government's seizure of his goods and refusal to recognize American rights on the Mississippi south of the Ohio.
